title: I honestly don't want URF to come back next year
body:
I already know this is going to get downvoted to hell from fanboys, but whatever.

Last year, URF was so fun. Everyone who played it was just looking for a good time. People played pretty much any champ and just saw how funny things could be or how they could mess around with people. This year 75% of people just tryhard. Every game has {{champion:120}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:81}} etc... If I wanted to have fun last year during this time, I would've gone to URF. This year there is literally more tryhards in URF than there is in ranked.

I feel like I would find Dominion more fun to mess around in, because god forbid I try to have fun in the gamemode designed for fun.

While you guys were fighting my Teemo was ripping towers down.

These are the tryhards we don't like. URF IS ABOUT KILLS! Not winning the game! Nobody cares if you win so long as you have fun! The only annoying thing is when your team is losing by a lot and other team is fed but won't end the game.

I had a lot of fun, and saw a lot more variation that what the OP described.
Isn't it funny that everyone who says "Only these champions are picked" have slightly different lists of champions?

I feel like URF hasn't even been fully explored. There are still so many sleepers, and potentially powerful champions out there. But everyone is too busy focusing on the current roster that everyone puts on a pedestal (not without good reason).

So true, I've been trying out champs that are pretty good but not popular.

My top 3 right now are Cho'Gath, Thresh, and Amumu.

Cho'Gath has a 1.8s cd rupture, and a 16s cd feast which reduces by half on minion kill. Pretty strong.
Thresh has infinite hook combo if you can aim it right.
Amumu is the most intensive, but hilarious if you pull it off right. If you mash w (despair) it's on a 0.2s cd and you can actually make it hit faster than every second. Pretty hilarious to play, you just go in and mash w and e as fast as you can after you ult!

No, Urf is a great idea, ruined by the community. I actually wish Riot had a perma-banned list of champs, so that we could actually do more targeted bans. Instead of the whole "If I don't ban this, there will be at least one of them in this game, and it will be miserable.". But I also play things with pretty clear weaknesses or fun off builds (AP{{champion:5}} ).
Tryharding in URF is like tryharding in Tetherball on a school playground. Sure, it's a fun diversion, but no one really cares if you're good at it.

I miss tetherball........I miss recess..........I miss childhood.........

Even when people do pick these champions, it's hilarious when spells have no cost and even when people are being insufferable tryhards, it's still fun, imho. When I found out that alistar was a thing in urf, I thought it was hilarious to see him spam his heal over and over again. I had to have died to him 10 times in lane and it was still funny to see this champ that's normally a real niche pick or not very common in soloqueue because he's difficult to use, just be so broken against a "standard" midlane pick. All of the others are fun to watch, like with hecarim spinning his scythe and zooming around the map, or leblanc just teleporting around everywhere... it's fun for me at least, and I don't even own any of those champions that you have on your list of characters for tryhards.

I personally love going in as veigar and getting so many stacks I 1-shot people. Even when you're losing you can just go to another lane where no one's paying attention, and just spam w-q combo to clear minion waves real fast, unless you're op enough to 1-shot pretty much all of the creeps in the wave... that's always fun.
Personally I feel if they do implement the mode again they should have 2 versions - Blind Pick and All Random.

I share the OP's sentiment. I would like to play fun things (Viegar ulting every 16 seconds, Anivia walling everywhere) but I can't do that when I'm dead, which I will be if I should ever take a single step into range of any click-assasin's ult (Zed, Diana, Kat, etc). And going tanky is almost pointless for everyone but Mundo since damage is so rampant, so there's nothing you can do but burst them faster than they can burst you, which would require you to play the same click-assasins as them.

I get the point. I've found Blitzcrank oppressive to lane against. At least with most of the poke champions, as long as you dodge around 90% of them you're going to be fine. I had a game against Blitzcrank+Sona lane and dodged his first 20 ish grabs before he finally hit me and it was still instant death. That was one game where I didn't have much fun, but I can't be sure whether it was that or it was like my post said, my lane teammate (who started jungle and came to lane around level 5) complained endlessly that Sona and Blitz were OP while he kept getting grabbed while typing. 

I don't think anyone isn't viable. The jungle is pretty easy so if your lane opponent wrecks you, just go farm the jungle or stay near your turret. Otherwise I think you need to place emphasis on someone in each lane having poke or mobility in order to make less valid picks able to survive the laning phase.

URF ended up coalescing into a meta last year as well, though, and everyone ended up picking only a handful of champions. To me, that just sounds like an opportunity to fine-tune the game mode even more next year, and see what happens. The changes to shields and heals already eliminated the bulk of abusive mechanics from last year, and most of the issues here I feel could easily be solved with a few number changes and extra rules (by having the cooldown on spell shields and abilities that make you untargetable start at the end of the effect by default, for example). There are a lot of champions out there I feel are both super-strong and amazingly fun at the same time ({{champion:432}} , {{champion:45}} , even {{champion:122}} ), so it's not like URF has to inevitably descend into a state of non-fun even if a meta does appear.

I just want another actual fun Featured Game.
